body:
Hello @apryor6! Thanks for updating the PR.



 - In the file [`pandas/tests/io/formats/test_to_html.py`](https://github.com/pandas-dev/pandas/blob/5026e904596f2aec10382e2efe1eb201f224c1f9/pandas/tests/io/formats/test_to_html.py), following are the PEP8 issues :

> [Line 1923:17](https://github.com/pandas-dev/pandas/blob/5026e904596f2aec10382e2efe1eb201f224c1f9/pandas/tests/io/formats/test_to_html.py#L1923): [E225](https://duckduckgo.com/?q=pep8%20E225) missing whitespace around operator
> [Line 1925:21](https://github.com/pandas-dev/pandas/blob/5026e904596f2aec10382e2efe1eb201f224c1f9/pandas/tests/io/formats/test_to_html.py#L1925): [W291](https://duckduckgo.com/?q=pep8%20W291) trailing whitespace



##### Comment last updated on September 19, 2017 at 21:00 Hours UTC
@apryor6 : Is there a reason why you keep pushing pep8 fixes?  You should probably try to check them locally first before pushing.
I rebased all the frivolous pep8 commits -- should be okay now.

I think the only main thing missing is the different encoding behavior for py2/py3 -- what's the preferred way to check python version? the `encoding` argument for `open` is not supported in py2

For checking, it'd be `from pandas.compat import PY2`.

I think in python 2 you can pass an encoding to codecs.open.

On Tue, Sep 19, 2017 at 4:03 PM, Alan (AJ) Pryor, Jr. <
notifications@github.com> wrote:
